title: Waste is a design flaw: How ReBorn is turning plastic waste into homewares | Virgin - Virgin
summary: ReBorn, a start-up transforming the homeware industry, uses industrial waste to create functional and design-led products.  Founder Brian Walmsley recognized the lack of sustainability in the homeware sector and partnered with Biffa and Studio Davis to create fully recyclable, reusable and repairable products made from recycled materials. ReBorn's products produce 79% less carbon emissions than imported products and are stocked in John Lewis stores across the UK.

title: An overview of solid waste management and privatization in kingdom of Bahrain - Frontiers
summary: Bahrain, a rapidly urbanizing island nation, faces a pressing waste management challenge due to its limited land area and increasing waste generation. This study investigates the country's efforts to address this problem, including the adoption of a National Waste Management Strategy and the implementation of privatization initiatives. The research focuses on analyzing the effectiveness of privatization in waste collection and disposal, evaluating its impact on service quality, environmental sustainability, and community engagement.

title: Malakoff Geared To Support Malaysia's Environmental Goals - BusinessToday
summary: Malakoff Corporation Berhad (Malakoff) is a Malaysian energy company focusing on environmental sustainability. Through its subsidiary Alam Flora, Malakoff provides solid waste management and public cleansing services, promoting recycling and implementing innovative solutions like the FIKS recycling center and RISE Kuala Lumpur facility. Malakoff is also exploring Waste-to-Energy (WTE) technology to reduce waste and create energy, contributing to Malaysia's goals of carbon neutrality and a circular economy.
